intro: Oldfieldia somalensis, commonly known as the Somali oldfieldia, is a flowering plant native to the dry regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
